meanings.definition: A cowboy or cattle driver in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The vaqueros herded the cattle across the vast plains.
meanings.sent2: The vaqueros rode their horses skillfully to round up the cattle.
meanings.sent3: The vaqueros tried line dancing with the cows, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: The vaqueros were the guardians of the wild frontier.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vaqueros on horseback is iconic in Western movies.

meanings.definition: A style of jeans originating in Mexico, typically with a high waist and wide legs.
meanings.sent1: She wore a pair of vaqueros with a tucked-in shirt.
meanings.sent2: Vaqueros are known for their comfortable fit and vintage look.
meanings.sent3: He tried to wear his vaqueros to a formal event, causing some raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her vaqueros swayed gracefully as she walked down the street.
meanings.sent5: The store had a variety of vaqueros in different washes and styles.
